page.title: 17A community school
page.content: Deeside high school in Clwyd not only offers education for children from the ages of 11 to 18 but also to any person who wishes to use its' facilities. The school has a pupose built community wing with a coffee bar which is used daily by the community and a series of rooms which organisations can use. People who wish to gain skills which they did not achieve in their normal schooling are encouraged to come to the school and join in lessons with the pupils. Many courses are offered from Basic maths and English up to subjects at O level and A level. In the evenings many groups such as computer clubs, rugby clubs, wine making groups and cycling clubs use the facilities of the school. This means that the buildings are used for the good of the community at all times
